attributes.action: Teach minors the laws to prevent underage pregnancy&trafficking and stop sex Ed
attributes.additional_details: Teach them the law to prevent the following :Underage pregnancy, pedophiles approaching minors & social services taking away kids due to the following.This is something that needs to be done to teach the younger generation of what is right&wrong. It will give the younger generation a safer future and surroundings knowing their rights and how to prevent such things. This will prevent children from been taken away from their parents by social services or being in danger.
attributes.background:
Stop teaching sex education to minors as they don’t require it until they are the age of 16.
This should be taught to those that it applies to based on the England and Wales legislation and laws.
Teach the children the necessary and essential things for a successful life.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want to see changes to what under 16s are taught in school, but it is not clear what aspects of the law you want to be taught, that are not already.

The Relationships and Sex Education curriculum already makes it clear that pupils should be taught about the concepts of, and laws relating to, sexual consent, sexual exploitation, abuse, grooming, coercion, harassment, rape, domestic abuse, forced marriage, honour-based violence and FGM, and how these can affect current and future relationships.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to, or the removal of, the Relationships and Sex Education curriculum, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted.
